metadata.Name: Maknuune
metadata.Description: A large, open-source computational lexicon for Palestinian Arabic. It contains over 10,000 entries, each with detailed morphological, phonological, and dialectal information, designed to be a foundational resource for Palestinian Arabic NLP.
metadata.Paper Title: Maknuune: A Large Open Palestinian Arabic Lexicon
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2023 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
metadata.Venue Name: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
metadata.Abstract: We present Maknuune, a large, open-source computational lexicon for Palestinian Arabic. Palestinian Arabic is a major Arabic dialect, but it has been under-resourced in terms of natural language processing tools and resources. Maknuune addresses this gap by providing a comprehensive lexicon of over 10,000 entries, each with detailed morphological, phonological, and dialectal information. The lexicon was constructed by integrating existing resources, crawling online content, and involving native speakers in a collaborative annotation effort. We describe the lexicon's design, construction process, and content. We also demonstrate its utility in a number of downstream NLP tasks, including part-of-speech tagging and dialect identification. Maknuune is a valuable resource for researchers and developers working on Palestinian Arabic and other Arabic dialects. The lexicon is publicly available on GitHub at https://github.com/Birzeit-NLP/Maknuune under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) license.
